attribs.name: personality_traits
attribs.current:
My qualms can't get in the way of exterminating my foes.

I watch over my friends as if they were a litter of newborn pups.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHAdh-Y8orLKNltWAi2_description
attribs.current:
You’ve learned to put the weight of a weapon to your advantage, letting its momentum empower your strikes. You gain the following benefits:

On your turn, when you score a critical hit with a melee weapon or reduce a creature to 0 hit points with one, you can make one melee weapon attack as a bonus action.
Before you make a melee attack with a heavy weapon that you are proficient with, you can choose to take a -5 penalty to the attack roll. If the attack hits, you add +10 to the attack’s damage.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LHVZGVa3EWn4AM5CzZi_itemcontent
attribs.current:
Includes:

• a backpack

• a crowbar

• a hammer

• 10 pitons

• 5 torches

• a tinderbox

• 10 days of rations

• a waterskin

• 50 feet of hempen rope

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LHVj5Tmp9DpKtyS1KKb_itemcontent
attribs.current: This potion's container looks empty but feels as though it holds liquid. When you drink it, you become invisible for 1 hour. Anything you wear or carry is invisible with you. The effect ends early if you attack or cast a spell.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHWjYCDkTpBAOBhRagX_description
attribs.current:
You can use your armor to deflect strikes that would kill others. You gain the following benefits:

Increase your Strength score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
While you are wearing heavy armor, bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage that you take from non-magical weapons is reduced by 3.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHWkl4EhaJwtKKg9hdB_description
attribs.current:
Your blessed touch can heal wounds. You have a pool of Healing power that replenishes when you take a Long Rest. With that pool, you can restore a total number of Hit Points equal to your paladin level x 5.

As an action, you can touch a creature and draw power from the pool to restore a number of Hit Points to that creature, up to the maximum amount remaining in your pool.

Alternatively, you can expend 5 Hit Points from your pool of Healing to cure the target of one disease or neutralize one poison affecting it. You can cure multiple Diseases and neutralize multiple Poisons with a single use of Lay on Hands, expending Hit Points separately for each one.

This feature has no effect on Undead and constructs.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHWkypzBjHkN4oSFzAf_description
attribs.current: While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHWlLdLFB2d1V5gcvwR_description
attribs.current: Starting at 2nd level, when you hit a creature with a melee weapon Attack, you can expend one spell slot to deal radiant damage to the target, in addition to the weapon's damage. The extra damage is 2d8 for a 1st-level spell slot, plus 1d8 for each Spell Level higher than 1st, to a maximum of 5d8. The damage increases by 1d8 if the target is an Undead or a fiend.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHWoM63kNibSvIUEFZ1_description
attribs.current: By 3rd level, the Divine Magic flowing through you makes you immune to disease.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LHWotbWnDXHoXgPbk24_spelltarget
attribs.current: Up to three creatures of your choice that you can see within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LHWotbWnDXHoXgPbk24_spelldescription
attribs.current: Up to three creatures of your choice that you can see within range must make Charisma saving throws. Whenever a target that fails this saving throw makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target must roll a d4 and subtract the number rolled from the attack roll or saving throw.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LHWotbWnDXHoXgPbk24_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LHWovnbyMhuTU2YbwQN_spelltarget
attribs.current: A creature that you can see within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LHWovnbyMhuTU2YbwQN_spelldescription
attribs.current: You choose a creature you can see within range and  mystically mark it as your quarry. Until the spell  ends, you deal an extra 1d6 damage to the target  whenever you hit it with a weapon attack, and you  have advantage on any Wisdom (Perception) or  Wisdom (Survival) check you make to find it. If the  target drops to 0 hit points before this spell ends,  you can use a bonus action on a subsequent turn of  yours to mark a new creature.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LHWovnbyMhuTU2YbwQN_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a  spell slot of 3rd or 4th level, you can maintain your  concentration on the spell for up to 8 hours. When  you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can maintain your concentration on the spell for up to 24 hours.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHWq8WH2lL8tnmzB7YU_description
attribs.current: As an action, choose one creature within 60 feet of you that you can see. That creature must make a Wisdom saving throw, unless it is immune to being frightened. Fiends and undead have disadvantage on this saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is frightened for 1 minute or until It takes any damage. While frightened,the creature's speed is 0, and It can't benefit from any bonus to its speed. On a successful save, the creature's speed is halved for 1 minute or until the creature takes any damage.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHWqN34S1oqTWAtXsRE_description
attribs.current: As a bonus action, you can utter a vow of enmity against a creature you can see within 10 feet of you. You gain advantage on attack rolls against the creature for 1 minute or until it drops to 0 hit points or falls unconscious.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LHWs1gd-cNRQ9WuZ1-8_spelltarget
attribs.current: Up to three creatures of your choice within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LHWs1gd-cNRQ9WuZ1-8_spelldescription
attribs.current: You bless up to three creatures of your choice within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to the attack roll or saving throw.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LHWs1gd-cNRQ9WuZ1-8_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LHWttzFvmWUca-xoxg-_itemcontent
attribs.current: Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LHWvSX1EYTSoGtbacnc_itemcontent
attribs.current:
Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

If you use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a melee attack, you treat the weapon as an improvised weapon (see "Improvised Weapons" later in the section). A sling must be loaded to deal any damage when used in this way.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LHWvSX1EYTSoGtbacnc_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Ranged Weapon, Damage: 1d10, Damage Type: Piercing, Range: 100/400

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LHZnFKvFoH2xhBqYzpU_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Melee Weapon, Damage: 1d6, Damage Type: Piercing, Range: 30/120

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHd9FH2TkQkRIA6JnmW_description
attribs.current: You have an excellent memory for maps and geography, and you can always recall the general layout of terrain, settlements, and other features around you. In addition, you can find food and fresh water for yourself and up to five other people each day, provided that the land offers berries, small game, water, and so forth.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHe1RadKZFomSi6P2gN_description
attribs.current:
You can keep your enemies at bay with reach weapons. You gain the following benefits:

When you take the Attack action and attack with only a glaive, halberd, or quarterstaff, you can use a bonus action to make a melee attack with the opposite end of the weapon. This attack uses the same ability modifier as the primary weapon. The weapon's damage die for this attack is a d4, and the attack deals bludgeoning damage.
While you are wielding a glaive, halberd, pike, or quarterstaff, other creatures provoke an opportunity attack from you when they enter the reach you have with that weapon.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LHe5lLq12QttZYl71p8_itemcontent
attribs.current: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LHe5lLq12QttZYl71p8_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Melee Weapon, Damage: 1d10, Damage Type: Slashing, Melee Attacks +1, Melee Damage +1

attribs.name: ideals
attribs.current:
I must earn glory in battle, for myself and my clan. 

I'm loyal to my friends, not to any ideals, and everyone else can take a trip down the Styx for all I care

attribs.name: flaws
attribs.current:
Violence is my answer to almost any challenge.

I have trouble keeping my true feelings hidden. My sharp tongue lands me in trouble.

attribs.name: bonds
attribs.current:
Someone I loved died because of a mistake I made. That will never happen again.

I protect those who cannot protect themselves.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHxK0FMSdISOPvcPL-e_description
attribs.current: Take an action analyzing a single enemy in combat. Next turn, if you hit this same target with an attack, treat one attack as if it were a critical strike. You may use this ability once per day. At level 10 you may use it twice per day. At level 15 you may use it thrice per day.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-LHxLeEBnHGniI-SZ9-q_spelldescription
attribs.current: Briefly surrounded by silvery mist, you teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space that you can see.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-LHxMZlq2ouQgXRf4ld-_spelltarget
attribs.current: Up to three creatures within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-LHxMZlq2ouQgXRf4ld-_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: A tiny strip of white cloth

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-LHxMZlq2ouQgXRf4ld-_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, a target’s hit points increase by an additional 5 for each slot level above 2nd.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-LHxMZlq2ouQgXRf4ld-_spelldescription
attribs.current: Your spell bolsters your allies with toughness and resolve. Choose up to three creatures within range. Each target’s hit point maximum and current hit points increase by 5 for the duration.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-LHxMn3EeEJq7KBIs3sF_spelldescription
attribs.current: You summon a spirit that assumes the form of an unusually intelligent, strong, and loyal steed, creating a long-lasting bond with it. Appearing in an unoccupied space within range, the steed takes on a form that you choose: a warhorse, a pony, a camel, an elk, or a mastiff. (Your GM might allow other animals to be summoned as steeds.) The steed has the statistics of the chosen form, though it is a celestial, fey, or fiend (your choice) instead of its normal type. Additionally, if your steed has an Intelligence of 5 or less, its Intelligence becomes 6, and it gains the ability to understand one language of your choice that you speak. Your steed serves you as a mount, both in combat and out, and you have an instinctive bond with it that allows you to fight as a seamless unit. While mounted on your steed, you can make any spell you cast that targets only you also target your steed. When the steed drops to 0 hit points, it disappears, leaving behind no physical form. You can also dismiss your steed at any time as an action, causing it to disappear. In either case, casting this spell again summons the same steed, restored to its hit point maximum. While your steed is within 1 mile of you, you can communicate with it telepathically. You can’t have more than one steed bonded by this spell at a time. As an action, you can release the steed from its bond at any time, causing it to disappear.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHxOxad-daRirSnsZbj_description
attribs.current: Beginning at 5th level, you can Attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on Your Turn.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LHzaGNJ20xEtYerCjZr_description
attribs.current:
At the 1st level, you have a covenant formed with a dragon, either the one you've bonded to or another. Choose one type of dragon as the creator of this covenant. Features you gain later use the damage type associated with each dragon.
Also, as an action, you can create small sensory effects appropriate to the colour of your dragon, similar to the ones described under the prestidigitation spell.
Finally, you can speak, read, and write Draconic.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LI8CIn775EdKYfM6KJp_description
attribs.current: When you roll a 1 or a 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon that you are wielding with two hands, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2. The weapon must have the two-handed or versatile property for you to gain this benefit.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LI8DAfVTjqMyHnRFAhL_description
attribs.current:
At 2nd level, you also have gained the ability to focus and sense nearby creatures. As a bonus action, you can hone in your senses to detect nearby creatures. 
You can detect the exact location of all living creatures within 30 feet of you, and gain advantage on your next attack roll against one of these creatures, providing you make the attack before the end of your next turn, and can't use this ability again until you finish a short or long rest.
You can use this feature twice between rests starting at 9th level and three times between rests at 17th level.

attribs.name: allies_and_organizations
attribs.current: Worships Auril, goddess of the cold.

attribs.name: character_appearance
attribs.current: Black eyes. Raven hair. Painted gold armor.

attribs.name: character_backstory
attribs.current:
Moon grew up a into a well off family on another continent. Her family worshiped the ancient god, Auril. She was friends with a street urchin, who she nicknamed Sun. They spent most of their childhood playing in the streets of their little town. 

Sun traveled off to a new continent with a thriving adventurer scene without telling Moon she was going. Chasing her best friend, Moon followed her trail until she came upon the Eternal Swords guild, wherein she finds Sun has died. At her grave, Moon swears vengeance on the one responsible for Sun's death.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LIWf0DTXnZF1zL63g2Z_description
attribs.current: The presence of strong evil registers on your Senses like a noxious odor, and powerful good rings like heavenly music in your ears. As an action, you can open your awareness to detect such forces. Until the end of your next turn, you know the location of any Celestial, fiend, or Undead within 60 feet of you that is not behind total cover. You know the type (celestial, fiend, or undead) of any being whose presence you sense, but not its identity (the Vampire Count Strahd von Zarovich, for instance). Within the same radius, you also detect the presence of any place or object that has been consecrated or desecrated, as with the Hallow spell.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LIXE16Fx1dyVIdOgM1v_description
attribs.current:
Starting at 3rd level, you and your dragon are able to coordinate to disorientate your enemies. When both you and your dragon are within 5 feet of a hostile creature, the creature has disadvantage on any attack roll that doesn't target you or your dragon.

Additionally, when a hostile creature's movement provokes an opportunity attack from you, you can use your reaction to attempt to grapple the target.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LIXEtRdeAypaVmzZiDy_description
attribs.current:
At 3rd level, you and your dragon's keen understanding of each other allows you to better act in battle. When you and your dragon roll initiative, your dragon can change initiative to match your own.

Additionally, if you can see your dragon, creatures that it can see don't gain advantage on attack rolls against you as a result of being hidden from you.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LIXhYZo0vHFIf7b1Ob4_itemcontent
attribs.current:
An Ioun stone is named after Ioun, a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of Ioun stone exist, each type a distinct combination of shape and color.

When you use an action to toss one of these stones into the air, the stone orbits your head at a distance of 1d3 feet and confers a benefit to you. Thereafter, another creature must use an action to grasp or net the stone to separate it from you, either by making a successful attack roll against AC 24 or a successful DC 24 Dexterity (Acrobatics) check. You can use an action to seize and stow the stone, ending its effect.

A stone has AC 24, 10 hit points, and resistance to all damage. It is considered to be an object that is being worn while it orbits your head.

You gain a +1 bonus to AC while this dusty rose prism orbits your head.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LIm3LFtO-tnruxVHM6A_spelltarget
attribs.current: A creature of your choice within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LIm3LFtO-tnruxVHM6A_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: A small parchment with a bit of holy text written on it

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LIm3LFtO-tnruxVHM6A_spelldescription
attribs.current: A shimmering field appears and surrounds a creature of your choice within range, granting it a +2 bonus to AC for the duration.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LJQegXxpZ710x94XDJN_itemcontent
attribs.current: Rations consist of dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LJU9Go0ARlhdxv3Dmn3_itemcontent
attribs.current:
Requires Attunement

You gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws while you wear this cloak.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LJU9Go0ARlhdxv3Dmn3_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Adventuring Gear, Ac +1, Saving Throws +1

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LJU9JSQfAKZm7BECcST_itemcontent
attribs.current:
Requires Attunement

You gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws while wearing this ring.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LJU9JSQfAKZm7BECcST_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Ring, Ac +1, Saving Throws +1

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LJU9UgR3oeXAW9a9xue_itemcontent
attribs.current: You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LJU9UgR3oeXAW9a9xue_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Heavy Armor, AC: 18, Ac +1

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LJgYdSMZDtf4b56YOBx_description
attribs.current:
You are a dangerous foe to face while mounted. While you are mounted and aren't incapacitated, you gain the following benefits:
You have advantage on melee attack rolls against any unmounted creature that is smaller than your mount.
You can force an attack targeted at your mount to target you instead.
If your mount is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LK8Wr4bD6Q5xIkmOHFw_itemcontent
attribs.current: While wearing these dark lenses, you have darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision. wearing the goggles increases its range by 60 feet.
